etymology.description: 八(八) (bā, "eight") + 口(口) (kǒu, "mouth") + 人(人) (rén, "person") — speech exchanged among people
etymology.interpretation: This character suggests the idea of communication or exchange through speech among individuals, signifying the concept of exchanging views or information.

examples.chinese: 我们需要进行货币兌换。
examples.english: We need to carry out currency exchange.

examples.chinese: 他们在商店里兌换商品。
examples.pinyin: tāmen zài shāngdiàn lǐ duìhuàn shāngpǐn。
examples.english: They are exchanging goods in the store.
